alert.note: Alert for Brookings; Gregory; Kingsbury; Lake; Moody (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 20 at 2:00PM MST by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...STRONG WINDS MAY LEAD TO BLOWING SNOW TONIGHT INTO SUNDAY... Increasing southerly winds will peak late this evening into early Sunday morning, with occasional gusts of 40 to 50 mph. In areas where snow cover is still sufficiently loose, these strong winds will lead to areas of blowing snow, which could reduce visibility to a mile or less at times. Further into Sunday, warming road surfaces may become susceptible to a melt and refreeze of drifting snow, which could also impact travel with stretches of icy roads. The strongest winds are expected along and east of the higher elevations along the Buffalo Ridge in southwest Minnesota, and would include portions of US Highway 75, US Highway 59, US Highway 14, as well as Minnesota State Highway 23 and 30. While not quite as strong as farther north, portions of Interstate 90 could also be impacted by reduced visibility at times. These areas could also see wind chill values tonight dip to around 25 below zero. However, warming temperatures after midnight should likewise allow wind chills to recover through the latter half of tonight.
